context: Act 3 Chapter 3.3 — Scandal breaks publicly. Driver implicated. Media firestorm.

lines.text: It happens at 6 AM on a Tuesday. The world wakes up and your name is everywhere.
Not the championship headlines you earned. Not the racing coverage. Something else. Something designed to destroy.

A leak. Massive. Documents, emails, recordings — everything Mina Park had been gathering, twisted and released prematurely. But not by Mina. By someone who wanted the information weaponized rather than investigated.

The narrative is surgical: you are not the victim of race fixing. You are the architect. A street racer who corrupted professional racing from the inside. A criminal who infiltrated the legitimate world to exploit it.
Your phone fills with notifications. News alerts. Text messages. Calls from numbers you don't recognize. The digital equivalent of a mob with torches.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: Don't turn on the television.
You turn on the television.

Your face on every channel. Old footage from underground races — someone recorded them despite the code. Professional races with commentary reframed as evidence of manipulation. Sound bites from people you've never met, claiming to have been coerced.

lines.speaker: News Anchor
lines.text: The scope of the scandal continues to widen this morning. Sources indicate the driver at the center of the investigation has ties to organized gambling operations, underground criminal enterprises, and a shadowy figure known only as 'Zero.'
They have your name connected to Zero. Not as a victim. As a partner.

choices.text: Call Mina Park. Find out who leaked the documents.
Call Jade. We need damage control now.
Go silent. Don't give them ammunition.

lines.label: mina_response
lines.speaker: Mina Park
lines.text: It wasn't me. My sources were compromised. Someone — Zero, it has to be Zero — got ahead of us. They took the evidence and reframed it. Made you the villain instead of the whistleblower.

lines.speaker: Mina Park
lines.text: This is what Zero does. When the truth threatens the system, Zero doesn't suppress it — Zero redirects it. Gives the public a sacrificial offering so they stop looking at the machinery.

lines.label: jade_damage_control
lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: Apex has suspended your contract pending investigation. The board made the decision at midnight. I fought it. I lost.

lines.speaker: Jade
lines.text: I'm going to fight for you. But I need you to understand — from this moment, you are radioactive. Every person, every organization, every sponsor that touches you gets contaminated. That's how they designed it.

lines.label: go_dark
lines.text: You turn off the phone. Turn off the television. Sit in the silence of a hotel room that feels like a cell.

Outside, the world disassembles your reputation with the efficiency of a pit crew stripping a car. Each bolt removed precisely. Each panel discarded. Until what's left is just a chassis with no bodywork — exposed, vulnerable, unrecognizable.

lines.label: accusation_aftermath
lines.text: Within 48 hours: Apex suspends your contract. Your racing license is under review. Sponsors pull their logos from your car and their money from your accounts. Social media becomes a cesspool of people who were your fans yesterday and your executioners today.
Within a week: the police announce they are reviewing your involvement in illegal racing activities. Not charging — reviewing. But the distinction doesn't matter in the court of public opinion.
Within two weeks: you are alone.
Zero's plan is elegant in its cruelty. The system continues. The corruption continues. Only the face changes — and your face was the one chosen to be sacrificed.
The fall is not a moment. It is a season. And winter has just begun.
